revised_title: The Physiological Action of Paraffinic Nitrites and Their Chemical Constitution
tldr: The authors investigate the physiological effects of paraffinic nitrites on blood pressure, pulse, and respiration. They find that nitrites cause a fall in blood pressure due to the dilatation of arterioles, and discuss the possible causes of this dilatation, whether it is a direct action on the vaso-motor centers or on the walls of the vessels.
